Description: Body sherd (mended from five fragments) of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two animal friezes separated by two lines (with very little black remaining); above, lion's forelegs; below, lion ( head missing) to right above two bands; at bottom, tips of two rays.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217, no. 12)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 90, no. A117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.088) (Phase 1)
